overview: To construct a software system, requirements must be analysed and modelled, and designs developed and evaluated; this subject teaches knowledge and skills needed for these tasks. This includes the development of static and dynamic models for aspects of both the problem space and the solution space. The emphasis here is on an Agile approach, and on techniques appropriate for object-oriented development.

• Analysis and modelling requirements
  • Developing, modelling and evaluating designs
  • Modelling using the Unified Modelling Language (UML)
  • Software design processes and principles
  • Common design patterns and software architectures
  • Tools for design and development
ilo: Apply their knowledge of modelling and design to solve computing problems
Work as an Individual and in a Team, with effective communication for software engineering tasks
Evaluate and apply appropriate choices of software tools in the modelling and design process
Engage in Life-long Learning with respect to the evolution of software processes
generic_skills: Ability to undertake problem identification, formulation and solution
Ability to utilise a systems approach to design and operational performance

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Project work covering activities such as the analysis, design and implementation of small to medium-sized applications, comprising: completion of workshop-based exercises related to project, ongoing throughout the semester; 2 small-team based projects requiring approximately 50-55 hours of work per student.  Projects are due around weeks 7 and 11.
assessment.hurdle: The project work is a hurdle and must be passed (20/40) to pass the subject.

assessment.brief: One written 2 hour closed book examination. Intended Learning Outcomes (ILO's) 1 to 4 are assessed in the examination.
assessment.hurdle: The examination is a hurdle and must be passed (30/60) to pass the subject.

date_times.contact_hours: One 1 hour lecture per week  and one 2 hour workshop per week
One 1 hour lecture per week and one 2 hour workshop per week
